alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Laramie County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 3:50PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laramie County through 415 PM MDT... At 350 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Hillsdale, or 17 miles east of Cheyenne, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Burns, Hillsdale and Carpenter. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 373 and 388. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Laramie County
